required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Survival Among Patients With Pancreatic Cancer Depending on Surgical Resection Rate
clinical_study.official_title: Survival Among Elderly Patients in Sweden With Right-sided Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma Depending on Resection Rate of Pancreaticoduodenectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this population-based study is to investigate how a high resection rate of pancreaticoduodenectomy affects overall survival among patients aged ≥70 years with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma. The secondary aim is to determine if a high resection rate of pancreaticoduodenectomy increases perioperative morbidity.

primary_outcome.time_frame: A little more than 10 years (from first patient to vital status)
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival among patients aged 70 years and over with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma in the pancreatic head

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Around 10 years (patients diagnosed between 1 January 2010 and 31 December 2018, latest dismissal from hospital january 2020)
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of severe complications among patients aged 70 years and over who had undergone pancreaticoduodenectomy for any reason

arm_group.arm_group_label: All patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma aged 70 years and older
arm_group.description: All patients in the registry aged 70 years and older with right-sided pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma

arm_group.arm_group_label: All patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma aged 70-79 years
arm_group.description: All patients in the registry aged 70-79 years with right-sided pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma

arm_group.arm_group_label: All patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma aged 80 years and older
arm_group.description: All patients in the registry aged 80 years and older with right-sided pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma

arm_group.arm_group_label: All patients resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy, all ages
arm_group.description: All patients in the registry resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy during the study period

arm_group.arm_group_label: All patients resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy, aged 70-79 years
arm_group.description: All patients in the registry resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy during the study period, aged 70-79 years

arm_group.arm_group_label: All patients resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy, aged 80 years and older
arm_group.description: All patients in the registry resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy during the study period, aged 80 years and older

intervention.description: All groups are divided into one high- and one low resection rate group depending on percentage of patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma resected per county and year (first three groups) and resection rate of pancreaticoduodenectomy per 100 000 inhabitants per county (last three groups)
intervention.arm_group_label: All patients resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy, aged 70-79 years
All patients resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy, aged 80 years and older
All patients resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy, all ages
All patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma aged 70 years and older
All patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma aged 70-79 years
All patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma aged 80 years and older

study_pop.textblock: All patients registered in the Swedish National Registry for tumours in the pancreatic and periampullary region diagnosed with right-sided pancreatic adenocarcinoma or resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed between 1 January 2010 and 31 December 2018
- Registered in the Swedish National Registry for tumours in the pancreatic and periampullary region
- Either a diagnosis of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreatic head or having been resected with pancreaticoduodenectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

patient_data.ipd_description: The data cannot be further shared by the researchers but is available on application to the Swedish National Registry for tumours in the pancreatic and periampullary region, provided the application is approved by the Swedish Ethical Review Authority
